title: League Help
body: Since the new update my retreat ping doesnt work? it jsut does the normal ctr left click ping?

replies.body:
I'm not sure if I understand this entirely but I'll try:

Use the drag ping panel from hold-click-and-drag after pressing G, and occasionally use press-V yellow ping.
my v (yellow retreat ping) doesnt work, it does a normal blue ping ( crt left click)

> my v (yellow retreat ping) doesnt work, it does a normal blue ping ( crt left click)

I am not sure what may be causing this but check your keybind in the options just in case, maybe something went wrong there (as this seems like an individual case, so it is unlikely to be something inherently wrong about client itself).

But if really can't see nothing to be wrong in the keybind, try defaulting all options (and restart) and re-customise. And if it still doesn't work then it's better to reach for a support ticket or you could attempt self-fix with the repair option or worst case, reinstall.
Happened to me too, but haven't given the settings and all that a sus yet so can't say if its fixable on our end or not.

> Happened to me too, but haven't given the settings and all that a sus yet so can't say if its fixable on our end or not.

Well shit, that sounds bad, I hope it's not a wide spread problem.

But in my understanding, I think there are 2 major ways to try and approach this to see if the client itself is faulty to begin with, 

1. Try defaulting all options in the options menu is 1 way so while you have to redo all your settings again but hopefully you can override it and/or fix it this way, 
2. the other is find the "input" txt file in the "Config" folder within the installation registry and either search for the line "evntPlayerPingCursorDanger=" and see whether or not the it's "[v]" or whatever your desired key input after the equal sign (don't forget the square bracket). Or let's go balls, and just delete the entire txt file and restart your keybind afresh upon relaunch much like option 1.

And there's also that good o' repair and reinstall.

If none of this worked, we've got a real problem.

Ahaha see the trouble is I'm too lazy to bother with most of those for something as simple as a ping that may or may not be fixed in a coming patch. Certainly though, if I get some more information about it I'll go from there, but at this point I think I'm just gonna play it by ear. I'm not super hardcore like I used to be so the effort/reward isn't enough for me to actually do anything yet :P
